page.title: 09RES. IN BURY & HOUGHTON cont
page.content: There is a first school in Bury which educates the majority of the children in Bury, whilst those in Houghton go to Amberley First School. A few of the farmers and professional families send their children to the private sector of education. The Bury school is 140 years old and has currently about 40 children who leave at the age of about 10+ to go to a middle school in Petworth. The majority of the inhabitants own a car, some families two or more, and few use public transport except perhaps for trips to London. There is no local bus service and the nearest railway station is at Amberley some 2 miles away. Their hobbies are also very varied although gardening is the most common. The families with cars generally shop at the nearest super markets whilst those without use the one local shop.
